thread.title: Lehigh Valley tennis stars head to nationals
thread.title_full: Lehigh Valley tennis stars head to nationals - The Morning Call

author: mcall.com
title: Lehigh Valley tennis stars head to nationals
text:
Five area tennis players are set to bring their skills to the national level.
Reigning District 11 champions Matt FitzMaurice of Emmaus and Nina DeLuna of Southern Lehigh will represent the Lehigh Valley and the USTA Middle States Junior Team in the USTA national championships in Cayce, S.C., beginning Thursday.
DeLuna, whose brother Michael is also on the squad, is fresh off a District 11 Class 3A singles championship and is ready to bring her game to the next level.
"It's a great opportunity. I have good friends on the team, and I'm especially excited to play with my brother," DeLuna said. "The tournament will definitely help me mentally and get ready for high school states."
FitzMaurice, who won the District 11 Class 3A singles title in the spring, is excited to play against a high level of competition in his last year of high school eligibility.
"It will be fun to play teams from other parts of the country," FitzMaurice said. "The tournament will give me great match experience and I think our team has a good chance to go far. We will all go out and play our best."
Also on the team are Parkland senior and defending District 11 Class 3A doubles champion Nick Kshatri and Easton freshman Elessa Jacobs, who finished runner-up behind Nina DeLuna in this season's singles tournament.
The Middle States team will be coached by Juan DeLuna.
WHO: Nicholas Kshatri (Parkland), Francisco Mowrey (Notre Dame-Green Pond), Michael DeLuna (Southern Lehigh), Elessa Jacobs (Easton), Matt FitzMaurice (Emmaus)
WHAT: USTA Junior Team Tennis National Championships
WHERE: Cayce, S.C.
WHEN: Oct. 22-Oct. 25
Dante Terenzio is a freelance writer.
